segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
7. Pairs
67. At Naḷakapāna (1st)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ yena naḷakapānaṃ nāma kosalānaṃ nigamo tadavasari.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants when he arrived at a town of the Kosalans named Naḷakapāna.

segments.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā naḷakapāne viharati palāsavane.
segments.en: There the Buddha stayed near Naḷakapāna in the parrot tree grove.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto nisinno hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time it was the sabbath, and the Buddha was sitting surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṃsetvā tuṇhībhūtaṃ tuṇhībhūtaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anuviloketvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk. Then he looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta:
“Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.

segments.pli: Paṭibhātu taṃ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammī kathā.
segments.en: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.
My back is sore,
I’ll stretch it.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato paccassosi.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” Sāriputta replied.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappesi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasi karitvā.
segments.en: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.

segments.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There Sāriputta addressed the mendicants:
“Reverends, mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Reverend,” they replied.
Sāriputta said this:

segments.pli: “Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …
segments.en: “Reverends, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

segments.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
segments.en: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, kāḷapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāyateva vaṇṇena hāyati maṇḍalena hāyati ābhāya hāyati ārohapariṇāhena;
segments.en: It’s like the moon in the waning fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only decline.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …
segments.en: In the same way, whoever has no faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

segments.pli: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
segments.en: can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
A faithless individual is in decline.
An individual with no conscience is in decline.
An imprudent individual is in decline.
A lazy individual is in decline.
A witless individual is in decline.
An irritable individual is in decline.
A hostile individual is in decline.
An individual with bad desires is in decline.
An individual with bad friends is in decline.
An individual with wrong view is in decline.

segments.pli: Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
segments.en: Whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

segments.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
segments.en: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, juṇhapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vaḍḍhateva vaṇṇena vaḍḍhati maṇḍalena vaḍḍhati ābhāya vaḍḍhati ārohapariṇāhena;
segments.en: It’s like the moon in the waxing fortnight. Whether by day or by night, its beauty, roundness, light, and diameter and circumference only grow.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, yassa kassaci saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
segments.en: In the same way, whoever has faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom when it comes to skillful qualities

segments.pli: paññā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no parihāni.
segments.en: can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
A faithful individual doesn’t decline.
An individual with a conscience doesn’t decline.
A prudent individual doesn’t decline.
An energetic individual doesn’t decline.
A wise individual doesn’t decline.
A loving individual doesn’t decline.
A kind individual doesn’t decline.
An individual with few desires doesn’t decline.
An individual with good friends doesn’t decline.
An individual with right view doesn’t decline.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Sāriputta:
“Good, good, Sāriputta!

suttaplex.blurb: At Naḷakapāna the Buddha invites Sāriputta to teach. He speaks of ten qualities that lead to decline or non-decline.
